page.title: 04A Typical Farm in Creeting
page.content: On June 11th, we visited Mr. ******'s farm. He has got 130 acres in Creeting St. Mary and 60 acres in Needham Market. He grows wheat and barley. Mr. ****** has got about 400 pigs. He showed us what they eat. First of all there was ground barley. Then he showed us middlings which was like bran. He also added concentrate. Then we went to see the piggeries. Anna asked why the pigs' tails were short, and he replied because otherwise they would bite each others off. Mr. ****** buys the pigs when they are ten weeks old and fattens them up for ten weeks. Then they go to the slaughter to be made into ham, pork, bacon and sausages. The young pigs are called weaners or store pigs and the pigs going for slaughter, cutters.
